DOC.brief_summary: Subjects ( N=48 ) poorly-controlled type 2 diabetes ( HbA1c > 7 % ) assign one 4 follow intervention randomise , parallel group design : [ I ] Control ( placebo injection ; exercise ) , [ II ] Anakinra ( 100 mg subcutaneous injection human recombinant interleukin-1 receptor antagonist ) , [ III ] Exercise ( 1 h cycle ergometry 75 % VO2max ) , [ IV ] Anakinra + Exercise . Pancreatic beta-cell function ( plasma insulin response ) measure intervention use hyperglycemic clamp ( 5.4 mM basal glucose ) combine GLP-1 infusion ( 0.5 pmol/kg/min ) arginine injection ( 5 g bolus ) .
DOC.criteria: Type 2 diabetes HbA1c > 7 % HbA1c > 7 % Age < 30 > 80 BMI < 25 > 40 kg/m2 Pregnancy Evidence chronic haematological/renal/hepatic/pulmonary/heart disease > 2kg weight change prior 6 month Alcohol consumption ( men : > 14 drinks/week ; woman : > 7 drinks/week ) Smoking Physical activity > 150 min/week Contraindication exercise Contraindication use anakinra
